Canceled.
good to go now.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/ad36af4f-b3da-4c92-bec7-1c7bc8841bff) for commit 5deb987a91935b7113b152f313d1b23c43332fca.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/c7c211a2-6d1e-4f0d-8696-1b38822992a6/to/ad36af4f-b3da-4c92-bec7-1c7bc8841bff) against commit 9c47f211ae5ce5b4778d963e30d433dfb96eb390:
```diff
  Benchmark                           Metric         Change
  =========================================================
- ~Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Limits   instructions    80.1%
```
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/cac4b76a-8f54-4389-80ed-b98e51f59b00) for commit f8938e93976da25c351c96ffb047f6629b7b50f6.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/c7c211a2-6d1e-4f0d-8696-1b38822992a6/to/cac4b76a-8f54-4389-80ed-b98e51f59b00) against commit 9c47f211ae5ce5b4778d963e30d433dfb96eb390:
```diff
  Benchmark                           Metric         Change
  =========================================================
- ~Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Limits   instructions    45.2%
```
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/7294f9cb-d617-4e18-98cb-e3d6ee0944f5) for commit 096443bc5eb5cbb6c47128a9f85b977fae4b5dcf.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/c7c211a2-6d1e-4f0d-8696-1b38822992a6/to/7294f9cb-d617-4e18-98cb-e3d6ee0944f5) against commit 9c47f211ae5ce5b4778d963e30d433dfb96eb390:
```diff
  Benchmark                           Metric         Change
  =========================================================
- ~Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Limits   instructions    39.6%
```
I think this is the best I can do. @mattrobball any thoughts?

- Did you check there are no particular pain points (eg a tactic or instance synthesis that is mainly responsible)?
- Did the file get 40% longer?

1. There are two defs that aren't instant but the slowness seems to be spread evenly through tactics.
2. The file length is almost 2x

So I think it's fine?
Yeah
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10221276168/job/28283438090)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10221276168/job/28283438822)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
Haha, I was about to ask whether we have this :) A challenge (which I don't need) is to prove the same for localization at a f.g. submonoid.

I don't think it is that hard actually. The same proof shows that the stalks are isomorphic and the underlying map is a topological embedding. To show that the image is open, we just need to show that it is the intersection of the basic open of the generators, which can't be that hard in lean right...?
Yeah probably not too hard. I was thinking about using induction and transitivity of open immersion and of localization.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(AlgebraicGeometry/Limits): Spec preserves finite coproducts
